info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 4:56PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BEAUFORT, CHARLESTON, COLLETON AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 455 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Burton, or over Port Royal, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to penny sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Beaufort, Port Royal, Clarendon, Jasper, Bennetts Point, Lemon Island, Sun City and Shell Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
